medical_history.chief_complaint: A rash, joint swelling and pain in the hands, and ocular erythema.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2.5 months prior to the current evaluation, starting with pain in the elbows, knees, hips, and wrists shortly after a rafting trip in Montana. The patient took ibuprofen and naproxen with minimal improvement. He experienced further symptoms including weakness and diaphoresis nine weeks before the evaluation and subsequently developed swelling of the tongue, diaphoresis, and shortness of breath along with urticarial rash one week after discharge from the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, osteoarthritis of the knees, macular degeneration, actinic and seborrheic keratoses, basal-cell carcinomas, benign arachnoid cyst, abdominal venous malformation, benign prostatic hypertrophy, lower-extremity thrombophlebitis, and heterozygosity for the factor V Leiden mutation.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of complications of Parkinson's disease at age 76; mother and uncle died of colon cancer (mother at age 69). Children are well.
medical_history.social_history: Married, lives in a suburb, retired from an office position, drinks alcohol rarely, does not smoke.
